description: Ministry declining exactly 20 percentage points QoQ (at MAJOR threshold)
validation_query: SELECT ministry_code, decision_year, decision_quarter, approval_rate, LAG(approval_rate) OVER (PARTITION BY ministry_code ORDER BY decision_year, decision_quarter) AS prev_qtr_approval, approval_rate - LAG(approval_rate) OVER (PARTITION BY ministry_code ORDER BY decision_year, decision_quarter) AS decline FROM view_ministry_decision_impact WHERE ministry_code = 'M_TEST_01' ORDER BY decision_year DESC, decision_quarter DESC LIMIT 2
notes: Tests exact 20 percentage point decline threshold - should trigger MAJOR (75)

description: Ministry declining 30 percentage points QoQ (CRITICAL decline)
validation_query: SELECT ministry_code, approval_rate, LAG(approval_rate) OVER (PARTITION BY ministry_code ORDER BY decision_year, decision_quarter) AS prev_approval, approval_rate - LAG(approval_rate) OVER (PARTITION BY ministry_code ORDER BY decision_year, decision_quarter) AS decline_pct FROM view_ministry_decision_impact WHERE ministry_code = 'M_TEST_02'
notes: Extreme 30 point decline indicates ministry crisis - should trigger MAJOR (75) or consider higher severity?

description: Ministry declining from 70% to 35% QoQ (rapid decline)
validation_query: SELECT ministry_code, ministry_name, current_quarter_approval, previous_quarter_approval, current_quarter_approval - previous_quarter_approval AS decline FROM view_ministry_decision_impact WHERE ministry_code = 'M_TEST_03'
notes: Rapid 35 point decline signals coalition friction or minister crisis. Validates 82% ministry decline prediction accuracy claim

validation_query: SELECT ministry_code, approval_rate, LAG(approval_rate) OVER (ORDER BY decision_year, decision_quarter) AS prev_approval FROM view_ministry_decision_impact WHERE ministry_code = 'M_TEST_04'
notes: Stable performance (-2% change) should NOT trigger - validates normal quarterly variation tolerance

description: New minister's first quarter adjustment (from 55% to 40%)
validation_query: SELECT ministry_code, decision_quarter, decision_year, approval_rate FROM view_ministry_decision_impact WHERE ministry_code = 'M_TEST_05' ORDER BY decision_year, decision_quarter LIMIT 2
notes: Initial transition period after minister replacement may show decline. Should first quarter after minister change be excluded?

description: Ministry declining 18 percentage points (just below threshold)
validation_query: SELECT ministry_code, approval_rate, LAG(approval_rate) OVER (ORDER BY decision_year, decision_quarter) AS prev_approval, approval_rate - LAG(approval_rate) OVER (ORDER BY decision_year, decision_quarter) AS decline FROM view_ministry_decision_impact WHERE ministry_code = 'M_TEST_06'
notes: 18 point decline (just below 20% threshold) masks significant decline. Consider lowering threshold to 15%?

description: Sustained decline: Q1 80% → Q2 70% → Q3 55% → Q4 40%
validation_query: SELECT ministry_code, decision_quarter, approval_rate FROM view_ministry_decision_impact WHERE ministry_code = 'M_TEST_07' AND decision_year = 2024 ORDER BY decision_quarter
notes: Sustained decline over multiple quarters (40 points total) more serious than single quarter drop. Should cumulative decline be considered?

description: Ministry with no previous quarter data (first quarter of operation)
validation_query: SELECT ministry_code, decision_quarter, approval_rate, LAG(approval_rate) OVER (ORDER BY decision_year, decision_quarter) AS prev_approval FROM view_ministry_decision_impact WHERE ministry_code = 'M_TEST_08'
notes: New ministry with no baseline comparison should NOT trigger. Rule should handle NULL previous quarter gracefully

description: Ministry declining 25% vs average ministry declining 5% (20% gap)
validation_query: SELECT m.ministry_code, m.approval_rate, m.approval_rate - LAG(m.approval_rate) OVER (PARTITION BY m.ministry_code ORDER BY m.decision_year, m.decision_quarter) AS decline, AVG(a.approval_rate - LAG(a.approval_rate) OVER (PARTITION BY a.ministry_code ORDER BY a.decision_year, a.decision_quarter)) OVER () AS avg_system_decline FROM view_ministry_decision_impact m, view_ministry_decision_impact a WHERE m.ministry_code = 'M_TEST_09'
notes: Significant deviation from other ministries (25% decline vs 5% avg) indicates ministry-specific issue not systemic problem

description: Coalition partner ministry declining 22% (government friction indicator)
validation_query: SELECT ministry_code, ministry_party, approval_rate, decline FROM view_ministry_decision_impact WHERE ministry_code = 'M_TEST_10' AND ministry_party IN (SELECT party FROM coalition_parties)
notes: Coalition partner ministry decline signals inter-party friction. More serious than single-party government decline - severity boost?

description: Ministry declining 21% in Q3 (summer vacation quarter)
validation_query: SELECT ministry_code, decision_quarter, approval_rate FROM view_ministry_decision_impact WHERE ministry_code = 'M_TEST_11' AND decision_quarter = 3
notes: Summer quarter (Q3) has lower activity. Should seasonal patterns be considered? Q3 decline may be less concerning than Q1/Q2/Q4

description: Ministry declining 25% in Q3 but recovering to 65% in Q4
validation_query: SELECT ministry_code, decision_quarter, approval_rate, LAG(approval_rate) OVER (ORDER BY decision_year, decision_quarter) AS prev_qtr FROM view_ministry_decision_impact WHERE ministry_code = 'M_TEST_12' ORDER BY decision_year DESC, decision_quarter DESC LIMIT 3
notes: Q3 decline but Q4 recovery suggests temporary issue not sustained crisis. Should recovery patterns mitigate previous decline alerts?
